title: Tool Leprechaun

properties.name: description
properties.value: Tool Leprechauns are non-player characters found near Farming patches around Gielinor. They provide two basic functions: store Farming tools and exchange harvested items into banknotes.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Tool Leprechaun
This article is about standard tool leprechauns. For Leprechaun Larry, see Tool Leprechaun (Larry).

SMW Subobject for NormalNPC location: VariousUses infobox: NPCNPC ID: 0Examine: Looks after your farming tools.Release date: 5 December 2005Image: File:Tool Leprechaun.pngIs members only: trueIs variant of: Tool Leprechaun
SMW Subobject for UnderwaterNPC location: UnderwaterUses infobox: NPCNPC ID: 7757Examine: Looks after your farming tools.Release date: 7 September 2017Image: File:Tool Leprechaun (underwater).pngIs members only: trueIs variant of: Tool Leprechaun

Tool Leprechauns are non-player characters found near Farming patches around Gielinor. They provide two basic functions: store Farming tools and exchange harvested items into banknotes.

All Tool Leprechauns can carry various Farming tools for you and you can retrieve them from any Leprechaun:

  • 100 rakes
  • 100 spades
  • 100 seed dibbers
  • 100 pairs of secateurs or magic secateurs
  • 100 gardening trowel
  • 1 watering can (any level of water) or Gricoller's can
  • 1 bottomless compost bucket
  • 1,000 plant cures
  • 1,000 empty buckets
  • 1,000 buckets of compost
  • 1,000 buckets of supercompost
  • 1,000 buckets of ultracompost

Noted versions of these items can be stored as long as there is space available. "Right-click" the item in storage to withdraw as a note.

Contents

  • 1 Noting Items
  • 2 Locations
  • 3 Treasure Trails
  • 4 Dialogue
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 Trivia

Noting Items[edit | edit source]

The Tool Leprechaun will note any items used on him that have been collected (or are collected) from Farming, including clean or grimy herbs as well as saplings. This is useful for inventory management when running between different farming locations.

The tool leprechaun will not note the following items:

  • Cave nightshade (non-tradeable)
  • Strange fruits
  • All kinds of logs
  • Cabbage (only at Falador farm). Tip: If you wanted to obtain noted cabbage picked from the public patch, you may do so at Hosidius.
  • White tree fruit (non-tradeable)
  • Rotten tomato

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

  • The Tool Leprechaun is the solution to the easy cryptic clue: Belladonna, my dear. If only I had gloves, then I could hold you at last. He is located at the Belladonna patch west of Draynor manor.

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 May 2019
(update)

Tool Leprechauns now have bank PIN protection.

16 May 2019
(update | poll)

Tool Leprechauns can now hold up to 100 rakes, dibbers, spades, trowels and secateurs.

2 May 2019
(update)

Willow branches have been added to the list of farming produce that Tool Leprechauns can turn into banknotes.

3 September 2015
(update)

Leprechauns can now hold up-to 255 buckets.

28 May 2015
(update)
  • Tool Leprechauns can now exchange weeds for bank notes.
  • The Tool Leprechaun at the farming patch just south of Falador has been moved slightly to be closer to where players are when using the farming patch.
26 June 2014
(update | poll)

Tool Leprechauns will now banknote tree roots.

23 May 2013
(update | poll)
  • Tool Leprechauns now stand near their patches rather than wandering so far away.
  • Tool Leprechauns will now convert your crops to banknotes. Use the items on the Leprechaun to make use of this facility.
22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • If a player tries to use a banknote on a Leprechaun, it will snarkily respond by saying, "That IS a banknote!".
  • There is a Tool Leprechaun on the roof of the Troll Stronghold that is lying in a chair and relaxing. He leaves during the battle against the Baby Roc and the Giant Roc, then comes back afterwards.
  • When the player tries to exchange cabbages into noted cabbages at the Falador farming patch, the Tool Leprechaun complains about cabbages and tells the player to take them away.
  • During the Lost City quest, the player can ask any of the Tool Leprechauns about the location of Zanaris. None of the Tool Leprechauns will tell the player, but will suggest that the player talks with Shamus instead.
  • Originally, Tool Leprechauns were said to teleport your tools and items into the Lumbridge shed for storage.
  • At current Grand Exchange prices, it would cost 1,948,036 to fill a Tool Leprechaun entirely.

'''Tool Leprechauns''' are [[non-player character]]s found near [[Farming]] patches around Gielinor. They provide two basic functions: store Farming tools and exchange harvested items into banknotes.

All Tool Leprechauns can carry various Farming tools for you and you can retrieve them from any Leprechaun:

*100 [[rake]]s
*100 [[spade]]s
*100 [[seed dibber]]s
*100 pairs of [[secateurs]] or [[magic secateurs]]
*100 [[gardening trowel]]
*1 [[watering can]] (any level of water) or [[Gricoller's can]]
*1 [[bottomless compost bucket]]
*1,000 [[plant cure]]s
*1,000 empty [[bucket]]s
*1,000 buckets of [[compost]]
*1,000 buckets of [[supercompost]]
*1,000 buckets of [[ultracompost]]

Noted versions of these items can be stored as long as there is space available. "Right-click" the item in storage to withdraw as a note.

==Noting Items==
The Tool Leprechaun will note any items used on him that have been collected (or are collected) from Farming, including clean or grimy herbs as well as saplings. This is useful for inventory management when running between different farming locations.

The tool leprechaun will '''not''' note the following items:
*[[Cave nightshade]] (non-tradeable)
*[[Strange fruit]]s 
*All kinds of [[Log (disambiguation)|logs]]
*[[Cabbage]] (only at [[Falador farm]]). '''Tip:''' If you wanted to obtain noted cabbage picked from the public patch, you may do so at Hosidius.
*[[White tree fruit]] (non-tradeable)
*[[Rotten tomato]]

==Trivia==
*If a player tries to use a banknote on a Leprechaun, it will snarkily respond by saying, "That IS a banknote!".
*There is a Tool Leprechaun on the roof of the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]] that is lying in a chair and relaxing. He leaves during the battle against the [[Baby Roc]] and the [[Giant Roc]], then comes back afterwards.
*When the player tries to exchange cabbages into noted cabbages at the Falador farming patch, the Tool Leprechaun complains about cabbages and tells the player to take them away.
*During the [[Lost City]] quest, the player can ask any of the Tool Leprechauns about the location of [[Zanaris]]. None of the Tool Leprechauns will tell the player, but will suggest that the player talks with [[Shamus]] instead.
*Originally, Tool Leprechauns were said to teleport your tools and items into the Lumbridge shed for storage.
*At current Grand Exchange prices, it would cost {{Coins|{{GEP|Rake|100}}+{{GEP|Spade|100}}+{{GEP|Seed dibber|100}}+{{GEP|Gardening trowel|100}}+{{GEP|Watering can}}+{{GEP|Bottomless compost bucket}}+{{GEP|Plant cure|1000}}+{{GEP|Bucket|1000}}+{{GEP|Compost|1000}}+{{GEP|Supercompost|1000}}+{{GEP|Ultracompost|1000}} round 0}} to fill a Tool Leprechaun entirely.

{{Farming tools}}
